data.rationale:
Skipjack is the secret key encryption algorithm designed by the
    National Security Agency, and is used in the Clipper chip and
    Fortezza PC card. It was implemented in tamper- resistant hardware
    and its structure had been classified since its introduction in
    1993. Skipjack was unclassified on June 24, 1998.

    Skipjack is an 80-bit key, 64-bit block cipher.
